Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The project was supported by U01-GM092691 of the Pharmacogenomics Research Network (PGRN), as well as from award number U54-LM008748 from the National Library of Medicine (NLM). The datasets used for the analyses were extracted from the Northwestern Medicine Enterprise Data Warehouse which was supported, in part, by the Northwestern University Clinical and Translational Science Institute, Grant Number UL1TR000150 from the National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences, Clinical and Translational Sciences Award (CTSA). The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the NIH. The CTSA is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS). Samples for analysis were provided by the NUgene Project at Northwestern University, with support from Northwestern Medicine and were genotyped by The Feinstein Institute for Medical Research. The algorithm used for identifying study subjects in the electronic helath record is described in the following article: RJ Carroll et al. Portability of an algorithm to identify rheumatoid arthritis in electronic health records. JAMIA, 2012 Jun;19(e1):e162-9. Epub 2012 Feb 28. PMID: 22374935.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.
May be used for genetic studies to learn about, prevent, or treat health problems. No Insurance companies.
